intro: Isometrum sichuanicum, commonly known as the Sichuan isometrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Isometrum sichuanicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
